text: the Seven Sisters Road in North London
just after midnight this footage filmed
by an eyewitness was recorded moments
after a van mounted the pavement and
struck several pedestrians the streets
have been filled with worshippers who
just left evening prayers at the
Finsbury Park mosque and the nearby
Muslim welfare house he looked straight
it looked straight like it was toward
Muslims was basically their target daily
woman who basically drove on the
pavement coming straight towards all the
Muslims and he as as he's coming to them
he hit all of them within hours the
Muslim Council of Britain claimed that
the van was intentionally driven that
worshippers police say the driver a 48
year old man was found by members of the
public and handed over to officers to be
arrested he since been taken to hospital
as a precaution I was coming from the
shops and I saw a large crowd of people
on the pavement
I learned after that Evander's was
standing out by the traffic lights was
the van that mowed the people done
several ambulances were on the scene
soon afterwards with trauma teams
treating the injured eight people were
taken to hospital in the early hours of
the morning Downing Street issued a
statement from tourism a saying her
thoughts were with all of those injured
the Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn who's
also a local MP said he was totally
shocked and had been in touch with
mosques in the area as well as Islington
Council this morning the scene remains
sealed off as counterterrorism officers
for the third time in as many months
investigative vehicle driven into people
on London streets with deadly
consequences
Greg Dawson BBC News
